explanation:
- mhd_tool_get_proc_cpu_count_sched_getaffinity_: This function is directly called by the target. MISRA’s for-loop rule requires inspecting the behaviour of any functions called from within a for loop (the loop body). Even though the target has no for loop, the callee may contain for loops whose clauses or called functions violate the rule — so its implementation must be examined.
- mhd_tool_get_proc_cpu_count_cpuset_getaffinity_: Same reason as above — it is another direct callee and may contain for loops or modify objects relevant to loop counters in its body.
- mhd_tool_get_proc_cpu_count_sched_getaffinity_np_: Direct callee; must be inspected for any for loops and side effects that could breach the MISRA requirements.
- mhd_tool_get_proc_cpu_count_w32_: Direct callee for Windows-specific code; inspect its implementation for for-loops or side effects that would be relevant under MISRA.
- __linux__: This compile-time macro controls which branch of the conditional is compiled (affects call ordering and which callees are relevant). To determine the actual compiled code path and therefore which callee implementations must be analyzed, the build configuration for __linux__ must be known.
- __GLIBC__: Same as __linux__ — it affects the conditional compilation path and thus which callees and code to inspect.

Note: If any of the listed callee functions themselves call other functions or reference global objects, those additional symbols will also be required; the static call graph provided shows no further callees for these four functions, so they are the immediate symbols required for a complete MISRA for-loop analysis of the target function.
